Browse the source code of netbsd/external/gpl3/binutils/usr.sbin/ncdcs/ncdcs.c

1/* $NetBSD: ncdcs.c,v 1.1 2009/08/18 20:22:20 skrll Exp $ */
2/*
3** Program to prepare an ELF file for download to an IBM Network
4** Station 300 or 1000 running the NCD firmware.
5**
6** This may also work for other loaders based on NCD code.
7**
8** The program expects a signature and some marker fields a couple
9** bytes into the image itself, where the checksum gets patched in.
10** The checksum itself is a 16bit CRC over the ELF header, the ELF
11** program header, and the image portion of the ELF file. The start
12** value for the CRC is 0xffff, and no final xor is performed.
13**
14** Usage: ncdcs <infile> [outfile]
15** e.g. ncdcs zImage zImage.ncd
16**
17** Copyright 2002 Jochen Roth
18** NetBSD changes copyright 2003 John Gordon
19**
20** This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
21** modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License,
22** Version 2, as published by the Free Software Foundation.
23**
24*/
25
26
27#include <stdio.h>
28#include <stdlib.h>
29#include <string.h>
30#include <sys/types.h>
31#include <sys/wait.h>
32#include <sys/stat.h>
33#include <unistd.h>
34#include <fcntl.h>
35#include <errno.h>
36
37#ifdef __NetBSD__
38
39unsigned short crc16(unsigned short crc, unsigned char *buf, unsigned len);
40unsigned short get_be_16(unsigned char *p);
41unsigned long get_be_32(unsigned char *p);
42void put_be_16(unsigned char *p, unsigned short x);
43void put_be_32(unsigned char *p, unsigned long x);
44
45#endif
46
47static const unsigned short crc16_table[256] = {
48 0x0000, 0x1189, 0x2312, 0x329b, 0x4624, 0x57ad, 0x6536, 0x74bf,
49 0x8c48, 0x9dc1, 0xaf5a, 0xbed3, 0xca6c, 0xdbe5, 0xe97e, 0xf8f7,
50 0x1081, 0x0108, 0x3393, 0x221a, 0x56a5, 0x472c, 0x75b7, 0x643e,
51 0x9cc9, 0x8d40, 0xbfdb, 0xae52, 0xdaed, 0xcb64, 0xf9ff, 0xe876,
52 0x2102, 0x308b, 0x0210, 0x1399, 0x6726, 0x76af, 0x4434, 0x55bd,
53 0xad4a, 0xbcc3, 0x8e58, 0x9fd1, 0xeb6e, 0xfae7, 0xc87c, 0xd9f5,
54 0x3183, 0x200a, 0x1291, 0x0318, 0x77a7, 0x662e, 0x54b5, 0x453c,
55 0xbdcb, 0xac42, 0x9ed9, 0x8f50, 0xfbef, 0xea66, 0xd8fd, 0xc974,
56 0x4204, 0x538d, 0x6116, 0x709f, 0x0420, 0x15a9, 0x2732, 0x36bb,
57 0xce4c, 0xdfc5, 0xed5e, 0xfcd7, 0x8868, 0x99e1, 0xab7a, 0xbaf3,
58 0x5285, 0x430c, 0x7197, 0x601e, 0x14a1, 0x0528, 0x37b3, 0x263a,
59 0xdecd, 0xcf44, 0xfddf, 0xec56, 0x98e9, 0x8960, 0xbbfb, 0xaa72,
60 0x6306, 0x728f, 0x4014, 0x519d, 0x2522, 0x34ab, 0x0630, 0x17b9,
61 0xef4e, 0xfec7, 0xcc5c, 0xddd5, 0xa96a, 0xb8e3, 0x8a78, 0x9bf1,
62 0x7387, 0x620e, 0x5095, 0x411c, 0x35a3, 0x242a, 0x16b1, 0x0738,
63 0xffcf, 0xee46, 0xdcdd, 0xcd54, 0xb9eb, 0xa862, 0x9af9, 0x8b70,
64 0x8408, 0x9581, 0xa71a, 0xb693, 0xc22c, 0xd3a5, 0xe13e, 0xf0b7,
65 0x0840, 0x19c9, 0x2b52, 0x3adb, 0x4e64, 0x5fed, 0x6d76, 0x7cff,
66 0x9489, 0x8500, 0xb79b, 0xa612, 0xd2ad, 0xc324, 0xf1bf, 0xe036,
67 0x18c1, 0x0948, 0x3bd3, 0x2a5a, 0x5ee5, 0x4f6c, 0x7df7, 0x6c7e,
68 0xa50a, 0xb483, 0x8618, 0x9791, 0xe32e, 0xf2a7, 0xc03c, 0xd1b5,
69 0x2942, 0x38cb, 0x0a50, 0x1bd9, 0x6f66, 0x7eef, 0x4c74, 0x5dfd,
70 0xb58b, 0xa402, 0x9699, 0x8710, 0xf3af, 0xe226, 0xd0bd, 0xc134,
71 0x39c3, 0x284a, 0x1ad1, 0x0b58, 0x7fe7, 0x6e6e, 0x5cf5, 0x4d7c,
72 0xc60c, 0xd785, 0xe51e, 0xf497, 0x8028, 0x91a1, 0xa33a, 0xb2b3,
73 0x4a44, 0x5bcd, 0x6956, 0x78df, 0x0c60, 0x1de9, 0x2f72, 0x3efb,
74 0xd68d, 0xc704, 0xf59f, 0xe416, 0x90a9, 0x8120, 0xb3bb, 0xa232,
75 0x5ac5, 0x4b4c, 0x79d7, 0x685e, 0x1ce1, 0x0d68, 0x3ff3, 0x2e7a,
76 0xe70e, 0xf687, 0xc41c, 0xd595, 0xa12a, 0xb0a3, 0x8238, 0x93b1,
77 0x6b46, 0x7acf, 0x4854, 0x59dd, 0x2d62, 0x3ceb, 0x0e70, 0x1ff9,
78 0xf78f, 0xe606, 0xd49d, 0xc514, 0xb1ab, 0xa022, 0x92b9, 0x8330,
79 0x7bc7, 0x6a4e, 0x58d5, 0x495c, 0x3de3, 0x2c6a, 0x1ef1, 0x0f78
80};
81
82
83unsigned short crc16(unsigned short crc, unsigned char *buf, unsigned len)
84{
85 while(len--) {
86 crc = crc16_table[(crc ^ *buf++) & 0xff] ^ (crc >> 8);
87 }
88 return(crc);
89}
90
91
92unsigned short get_be_16(unsigned char *p)
93{
94 unsigned short x = 0;
95 x = (unsigned short)p[0];
96 x = (x<<8) + (unsigned short)p[1];
97 return(x);
98}
99
100
101unsigned long get_be_32(unsigned char *p)
102{
103 unsigned long x = 0;
104 x = (unsigned long)p[0];
105 x = (x<<8) + (unsigned long)p[1];
106 x = (x<<8) + (unsigned long)p[2];
107 x = (x<<8) + (unsigned long)p[3];
108 return(x);
109}
110
111
112void put_be_16(unsigned char *p, unsigned short x)
113{
114 p[0] = (x >> 8);
115 p[1] = x;
116}
117
118
119void put_be_32(unsigned char *p, unsigned long x)
120{
121 p[0] = (x >> 24);
122 p[1] = (x >> 16);
123 p[2] = (x >> 8);
124 p[3] = x;
125}
126
127
128int main(int argc, char *argv[])
129{
130 char *infile, *outfile;
131 struct stat st;
132 unsigned char *buf, *image, *p;
133 int fd, filesize, old_filesize;
134 unsigned long hdr_len, img_len, img_offset;
135 unsigned short crc, old_crc;
136
137 /* check arguments */
138
139 if(argc < 2 || argc > 3 || argv[1][0] == '-') {
140 printf("usage: %s <elf-image> [ncd-image]\n", argv[0]);
141 return(1);
142 }
143
144 infile = argv[1];
145 outfile = argc > 2 ? argv[2] : NULL;
146
147 /* determine file size, allocate buffer, open and read elf file */
148
149 if ((fd = open(infile, O_RDONLY)) == -1) {
150 perror(infile);
151 return(-1);
152 }
153
154 if (fstat(fd, &st) == -1) {
155 perror(infile);
156 close(fd);
157 return(-1);
158 }
159 buf = malloc(st.st_size + 4);
160 if (buf == NULL) {
161 perror(infile);
162 close(fd);
163 return(-1);
164 }
165 filesize = read(fd, buf, st.st_size);
166 if (filesize != st.st_size) {
167 perror(infile);
168 close(fd);
169 return(-1);
170 }
171 close(fd);
172
173 /* verify elf header */
174
175 if(memcmp(buf, "\177ELF", 4)) {
176 fprintf(stderr, "%s: not an ELF file\n", infile);
177 return(-1);
178 }
179 if(buf[0x04] != 1 || buf[0x05] != 2 || get_be_16(buf+0x12) != 20) {
180 fprintf(stderr, "%s: not a 32bit big-endian PPC ELF file\n", infile);
181 return(-1);
182 }
183 if(get_be_32(buf+0x1c) != 0x34) {
184 fprintf(stderr, "%s: ELF PPC program header not at expected offset\n", infile);
185 return(-1);
186 }
187
188 if((img_offset = get_be_32(buf+0x38)) != 0x10000) {
189 /*
190 * Doesn't seem to bother the device when the header is less
191 * than 64K, and the default builds for NetBSD always generate
192 * images that are not padded to a 64K boundary...
193 */
194#ifndef __NetBSD__
195 fprintf(stderr, "warning: %s: size of ELF header is not 64k\n", infile);
196#endif
197 }
198
199 /* verify checksum area markers */
200
201 image = buf + img_offset;
202 if(memcmp(image + 0x10, "XncdPPC", 8)) {
203 fprintf(stderr, "%s: missing XncdPPC marker\n", infile);
204 return(-1);
205 }
206
207 /* zero out the checksum and size fields, then compute checksum */
208
209 p = image + 0x18;
210 old_crc = get_be_16(p);
211 old_filesize = get_be_32(p+4);
212
213 memset(p, 0, 8);
214
215 hdr_len = get_be_16(buf+0x28) + get_be_16(buf+0x2a);
216 img_len = get_be_32(buf+0x44);
217
218 crc = 0xffff;
219 crc = crc16(crc, buf, hdr_len);
220 crc = crc16(crc, buf + img_offset, img_len);
221
222 printf("%s: hdr_len=0x%x img_offset=0x%x img_len=0x%x crc=0x%04x fsz=0x%06x\n", infile, (int) hdr_len, (int) img_offset, (int) img_len, crc, filesize);
223
224 if(outfile) {
225 /* patch in the crc and the total file size (???) */
226
227 put_be_16(p, crc);
228 put_be_32(p+4, filesize);
229
230 if((fd = open(outfile, O_RDWR|O_CREAT|O_TRUNC, st.st_mode)) < 0) {
231 perror(outfile);
232 return(-1);
233 }
234
235 if(write(fd, buf, filesize) != filesize) {
236 perror(outfile);
237 return(-1);
238 }
239 close(fd);
240 } else {
241 /* Check the crc and filesize fields in the file */
242
243 if((crc == old_crc) && (filesize == old_filesize)) {
244 printf("%s: NCD crc and filesize seem ok.\n", infile);
245 } else {
246 printf("%s: NCD current crc=0x%04x fsz=0x%06x\n", infile, old_crc, old_filesize);
247 }
248 }
249
250 return(0);
251}
